pageList.title: Alerts
pageList.excerpt: learn, add, blocks, content, alerts, types, colors
pageList.autoSummary: Alerts can be of different types as shown by the colors (,,, and ). Alerts can contain content introduced in clear but also can refer. From other documents from your documentation or from external public or private repositories. There is no limit about how many external public repositories you refer.

pageList.title: Components
pageList.excerpt: learn, add, pre, defined, content, components, elements, embedded
pageList.autoSummary: Pre-defined components are elements that can be embedded in your documents using. As it will be shown for each of the next components. Docaroo gives you the following. Components: alert type notifications inside your docs. Different types of rich media such as videos or figma files inside your.

pageList.title: Content items
pageList.excerpt: docaroo, series, content, items, enrich, documents, effiient, incorporate, piecers
pageList.autoSummary: Documentation is written in English with no greetings or instructions, maximum 50 words, for the following text:: docaroo makes available a series of content items that can be used to enrich your documents.

pageList.title: Downloads
pageList.excerpt: download, link, component, generates, button, downloading, files, documentation
pageList.autoSummary: The download-link component generates a button link for downloading files from your documentation site. Only downloading from your site is allowed, for security reasons it is not allowed to create download links targeting files hosted on external sites.

pageList.title: FAQ Item
pageList.excerpt: learn, add, elements, documents, element, question, answer
pageList.autoSummary: The question should always be a text. The answer to the question can be simple text or any rich content that is allowed in markdown. Any docaroo component can be used to render the answer to a question.

pageList.title: Link button
pageList.excerpt: learn, add, link, buttons, content, helps, users, navigate
pageList.autoSummary: Link buttons helps users to navigate inside your documentation or access external sites. You can add individual link buttons or group link buttons. You can place anchors anywhere in the document and references to them.

pageList.title: Rich media
pageList.excerpt: learn, docaroo, components, embed, rich, media, content, encourage, store
pageList.autoSummary: Use docaroo components to embed rich media into your content. Currently we support design, boards (fig jam), slides and deck files. Prototypes are not supported for the moment.

pageList.title: Scroll Spy & Tabs
pageList.excerpt: and, are, great, ways, organising, information, inside, your, documents, made
pageList.autoSummary: Scroll spies are great ways of organising information inside your documents. We made them flexible and easy to be included in the documents. Any docaroo component, including importing esternal content or rich content ones, can be used to populate scroll spies and tabs.

pageList.title: XLSX Tables
pageList.excerpt: users, creating, table, markdown, challenge, merged, cells, crazy, quick, maintaining
pageList.autoSummary: Creating a table in markdown can be quite a challenge. Why not create tables in excel and loading them in our docs? This component does this now. See how tables from excel can be imported in your document.

pageList.title: Content
pageList.excerpt: learn, structure, content, efficient, secret, maximum, extent, features, importing, external
pageList.autoSummary: There are two types of content that you can use in your documents:. Content directly included in your document or content imported from. External sources are very important because allows you to create reusable pieces of content.

pageList.title: External content
pageList.excerpt: docaroo, documents, external, content, create, import, multiple
pageList.autoSummary: Documentaroo allows you to create. Of content and import these parts in multiple places in your documents. It is possible to import content from external public and private repositories. You must be sure that the content you want to import is available at the time when you build your site.

pageList.title: Get started
pageList.excerpt: started, docaroo, requires, design, documentation, organising, blog, crucial, involve
pageList.autoSummary: Getting started with docaroo requires, first of all, to design your documentation. Organising well your documentation (or blog) is crucial. This will involve defining the folder structure and also the taxonomies. Docaroo can take care of automatically generating other information about you documentation.

pageList.title: Introduction
pageList.excerpt: documentation, builder, guide, comprehensive, resource, learning, create, build, maintain, quality
pageList.autoSummary: This guide will walk you through everything you need to know about building a complete, maintainable, and professional documentation site from scratch. This guide is suitable for:. Developers who want to document apis, libraries, or frameworks product teams building internal or customer-facing documentation technical writers looking to improve structure and.

engLanguage.page_full_info_tags_short_explanation: Enter tags one by one and hit enter after each one. You can enter multiple tags in a single batch. When ready, hit enter again. Right click (or press long on mobile) on a tag to remove it. System tags (blue) cannot be deleted.
engLanguage.page_full_info_tags_context_menu_remove_: Remove the tag only from the document
Remove the tag from all documents
engLanguage.page_full_info_cats_short_explanation: Enter categories one by one and hit enter after each one. You can enter multiple categories in a single batch. When ready, hit enter again. Right click (or press long on mobile) on a category to remove it. System categories (red) cannot be deleted
engLanguage.page_full_info_cats_context_menu_remove_: Remove the category only from the document
Remove the category from all documents
